page.title: 17NW.SHERBORNE:FARMING (1)
page.content: Other than the small corner of the block which is covered by part of Sherborne,{agriculture}dominates the area. For the most part the farming is a mixture of{dairy and arable.} Most of the dairy herds here are {Friesian}although there is at least one herd of{Guernsey}cattle. About a quarter of the farmland here is used for producing{silage}for feeding the cattle when they are inside. Two and sometimes three crops of silage are taken a year, a smaller amount of {hay}is also made. When the cattle are allowed out for grazing during the summer months, fields close to the milking parlour have to be used. Milk awaiting{collection}is stored in refrigerated tanks at the farms. Milk tankers collect from the farms daily. Farms cut off in winter store milk in large trailer-size plastic containers.
